testimony.quarrel_subject: Jehanne put her out of her seat in church several times

witnesses.name: Phelippe Passaige
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived in same house 6 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Jehanne used threatening words to witness's son
Charity given to witness by wife of late Nicolas Drouard
Jehanne was angry when she found out witness had obtained bread and salt from her house
Jehanne spoke about Barbe femme Isaac Ferré, said she had done her great harm and wished her bad health

witnesses.name: Barbe Chocquart
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: femme Nicolas Rennial, marchand; former neighbor

testimony.quarrel_subject: Discontinued usual alms to accused; Jehanne remarked that witness thought less of dead children now she had another child alive

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: PG (C.M. Rémy) asks for interrogation and confrontations

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves interrogation and confrontations

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: First interrogation; she denies all charges

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; she reproaches some witnesses

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Substitut asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - thumbscrews, rack (2 turns), tortillons - she confessed nothing

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Change de Nancy concurs with release

timeline.subject: Jehanne Villaume
timeline.details: Formal order for release from court at St Nicolas

prior_accusations.context: Maire told Jehanne on arrest that she had been accused as witch by Jacqueline Manouvrier

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (to Elizabeth about her son)
notable_quotes.english: you will have your little devil
notable_quotes.context: Accused took witness's son by arm and said this after he was quarrelling

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (to Claudon veuve Aubertin Laurent about Barbe Ferré)
notable_quotes.context: Jehanne wished bad health to Barbe Ferré

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (about Jacquatte veuve Vaultrin Contal)
notable_quotes.context: Jehanne's reproach to witness during confrontations

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (asking Jehanne Pierat)
notable_quotes.french: sy elle estimoit qu'elle fut meschante
notable_quotes.english: if she thought she was wicked
notable_quotes.context: Jehanne confronted witness about suspecting her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: que ceulx a qui elle a faict autrefois du bien, luy rendent le mal
notable_quotes.english: those to whom she formerly did good, now repay her with evil
notable_quotes.context: During torture, expressing bitterness about witnesses

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehanne Villaume (under torture)
notable_quotes.context: Called out many times during torture but would confess nothing

relationships.evidence_text: veuve Pierre Louvet, drappier de St Nicolas
First husband had been Epnon Guerin dit Pettiat
Jehanne Pierat, femme Claudin Biquel, marchand
Barbe Chocquart, femme Nicolas Rennial, marchand
Anthoinette Marchal, femme François Racquenel, boulangier

economic_context.details: Jehanne accused witness Jacquatte of stealing wine from cellar of late Nicolas Drouard. Disputes over charity given by wife of Nicolas Drouard. Jehanne received alms from Anthoinette Marchal. Jehanne described as 'poor widow' during torture.

harms_catalog.harm_description: paralysed and very hot, looking as if she had been burned from waist down
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehanne pulled child by clothes and made her fall in church, telling her off; had put her out of seat in church several times

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter aged 18 months of Phelippe Passaige
son of Elizabeth femme Mengin Barillat
harms_catalog.harm_description: arm all swollen; holes appearing as soon as one place got better
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Son was quarrelling with son of previous witness; Jehanne took him by arm and said 'tu auras ton peut diable'; witness told Jehanne off for using such words
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch (took by arm) and threatening words

harms_catalog.victim_name: daughter aged 2 of Jacquatte veuve Vaultrin Contal
harms_catalog.harm_description: emaciated although she ate all the time, with neck twisted; ill for 9 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehanne was envious over charity given to witness by wife of late Nicolas Drouard; Jehanne knew witness was angry with her though witness had only spoken to her husband about it
harms_catalog.method_alleged: knowledge of hidden information (knew witness was angry though only told husband)

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Barbe femme Isaac Farré
harms_catalog.harm_description: became black and twisted a week after birth, died 3 weeks later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehanne was angry when she found out witness had obtained bread and salt from her house for child of Claudin Biquel

harms_catalog.victim_name: child aged 10 months of Anthoinette Marchal
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill; died day after Jehanne finished neuvaine
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jehanne met witness and said she did not go to cemetery so often and thought less of dead children now she had another child alive; witness had discontinued usual alms

material_culture.context: Counter-magic remedy obtained from Jehanne's house through a neighbor; used to cure children
Jehanne made neuvaine in church with candles for sick child
Jehanne gave child an apple and some bread during healing attempt
Jehanne accused Jacquatte of stealing wine from cellar of late Nicolas Drouard

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused and witnesses
Location where several incidents occurred (child pulled by clothes, seats disputed, neuvaine performed)
Where Anthoinette Marchal went to sprinkle holy water on graves of dead children

economic_hardship_indicators: Jehanne called herself 'poor widow' during torture
religious_calendar_references: Grand Jubilé mentioned as temporal reference point

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jehanne accused Jacquatte of stealing wine from cellar of late Nicolas Drouard and inciting his maid to do likewise
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Jacquatte admitted affair and stealing wine on suggestion of chambermaid; confessed to Drouard who forgave her

legal_context.redress_outcome: Jehanne confronted Jehanne Pierat and told her she did her great wrong to suspect her; asked 'if she thought she was wicked'

hearsay_chains.content: Heard from midwife that Jehanne was angry when she found out about bread and salt

emotional_state_notes: Called out 'Jesus Maria' many times during torture
Went very red in face during racking
Asked for mercy as 'poor widow' during torture
Insisted against damnation of soul she was innocent

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called Jacquatte 'ribaude, lairosse et attrairesse' (ribald, thief and slanderer); accused her of stealing wine from cellar of late Nicolas Drouard and inciting his maid to do likewise
Said even if she had bread and salt from her house, she did not know this was cause of cure
Admitted wishing 'mal santé' to Barbe Ferré, but said this was because she had accused her of being witch

third_parties.name: Nicolas Drouard (late)
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: His wife gave charity to accused and to Jacquatte
third_parties.context: Deceased; his wife gave charity that was source of dispute; Jehanne accused Jacquatte of stealing wine from his cellar

third_parties.name: wife of late Nicolas Drouard
third_parties.context: Source of charitable giving that led to dispute

third_parties.name: Jacqueline Manouvrier
third_parties.context: Maire told Jehanne on arrest that she had been accused as witch by Jacqueline Manouvrier

third_parties.name: surgeon (unnamed)
third_parties.context: Could do nothing for paralyzed child of Jehanne Pierat; unable to cure swollen arm of Elizabeth's son

third_parties.name: midwife (unnamed)
third_parties.context: Told Barbe that Jehanne was angry about bread and salt incident

third_parties.name: wetnurse (unnamed)
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: cared for child of Phelippe Passaige
third_parties.context: Jehanne said child of Phelippe Passaige returned ill from the wetnurse

third_parties.name: chambermaid of Nicolas Drouard
third_parties.context: Jehanne said Jacquatte incited this maid to steal wine

third_parties.name: young man (unnamed)
third_parties.context: Jacquatte admitted having affair with young man who promised marriage

third_parties.name: mother of Jehanne Villaume
third_parties.context: Barbe Chocquart had often been in house of Jehanne and her mother

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a well-documented trial with clear procedural records. Jehanne Villaume was released after withstanding torture, which is relatively unusual. The case centers on healing practices and counter-magic (bread and salt remedies). Key uncertainties: (1) The exact nature of Jehanne's healing practice - witnesses sought her help and she performed neuvaines, but she's classified as 'practiced_healing: true' with 'other' type since it's religious/ritual rather than herbal or medical. (2) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on receiving alms, being called 'poor widow,' and disputes over charity, though her husband was a drappier (cloth merchant) suggesting possible economic decline after widowhood. (3) The relationship between Anthoinette Marchal and Ydatte Marchal (formal accuser) is unclear - possibly related given shared surname. (4) Some witness ages/occupations are given as part of spouse identification rather than directly. (5) The 'Grand Jubilé' reference provides temporal context but exact year unclear (likely 1600 or 1606). (6) Witness 8 (Barbe Chocquart) only suspected Jehanne retrospectively after arrest, making her testimony weaker. (7) The trial shows extensive involvement of Change de Nancy, which approved both torture and release.
